intro: Fagonia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf fagonia, is a shrub native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, providing some drought resistance.
